page.title: 08ROWING ON ST.MARTINS I.O.S
page.content: On the island not very much sport is played because of the small population.But every Friday between May and October there is a gig race for the men, and every other Wednesday the ladies have a gig race too.A gig race is when long thin boats called gigs are rowed by six men or women over varied courses.After the race the crews and coxwains go to the pub to celebrate or relax together.There is keen competition, and the crews race for trophies which are presented at a dinner at the end of the season.The Dolphin is the St.Martins gig,it was launched in 1969 and was built locally.It's dimensions and lines are based on those of the original pilot gigs.It is painted silver.Also gig racing is a source of entertainment because the pleasure boats do trips for supporters to watch the races.
